attributes.action: Get The Department for Transport to improve & repair roads around Stafford
attributes.additional_details: The M6 is being closed more and more at least twice a month at present. Roads within Stafford are constantly being closed for sewer and other repairs to be carried out. However, there doesn't appear to be any co-ordination of this work. Large housing projects will only increase the pressure on local roads which are not capable of carrying the existing traffic.
attributes.background: Every time the M6 is closed at either junction 11, 12, 13 or 14 Stafford and the surrounding roads become grid locked. This is causing addition erosion of existing roads which are not being repaired, causing damage to residents vehicles & increasing the risk of injury to road users

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Local roads are the responsibility of your local council. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: 

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors 


You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here: 

https://www.staffordshire.gov.uk/yourcouncil/petitions/Home.aspx
